The proxy block creates and executes a proxy request to a backend service.
block creates and executes a proxy request to a backend service.
w/o a label has an implicit name
and the name can be defined via

May be relative to an origin specified in a referenced or nested `backend` block.","name":"url","type":"string"},{"default":"false","description":"Allows support for WebSockets. This attribute is only allowed in the \"default\" proxy block. Other `proxy` blocks, `request` blocks or `response` blocks are not allowed within the current `endpoint` block. Mutually exclusive with `websockets` block.","name":"websockets","type":"bool"}]
attribute is specified and its value is an absolute URL, the protocol and host parts must be the same as in the value of the {origin} attribute of the used backend.
